parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name or implicitly endorse any particular party.  While it discusses the importance of voting in parliamentary elections, it does not advocate for or against any specific candidate or party.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its content is clearly intended to reach a wide audience, not just a select few individuals. The reach estimate is ">1M", further supporting this.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's objective is to encourage voter participation in the parliamentary elections by highlighting the significance of these elections compared to presidential elections. It does this by presenting a chronological overview of systemic issues in Romania over the past four years, suggesting that the outcome of the parliamentary elections will significantly impact the country's future. While it aims to influence voters to participate, it does not explicitly advocate for or against any specific candidate or party. Therefore, it does not directly aim to influence the vote for a particular candidate.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post presents itself as an analysis of political events and their impact on Romania. It uses a chronological approach to highlight systemic issues and their potential connection to parliamentary elections.  While it has an opinionated tone, it attempts to present information and analysis, which aligns with journalistic practices. The link directs to an article on panorama.ro, further suggesting a journalistic approach.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>While the post expresses an opinion on the importance of parliamentary elections, it does not express a personal opinion unrelated to the electoral process. The opinion is directly related to encouraging voter participation and understanding the impact of parliamentary elections.  It does not fall under the category of personal opinion not intended to influence the vote.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1774815166705025</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while discussing the importance of parliamentary elections and presenting an analysis of past events, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  It does not explicitly endorse or oppose any specific candidate or party.  The post encourages voter participation, but this is not prohibited. The analysis presented is presented in a journalistic style, aiming to inform and encourage engagement, not to sway votes towards a specific candidate.  The fact that it's a paid advertisement does not automatically make it electoral propaganda; the content itself must meet the criteria for such classification.  In this case, the content focuses on the importance of the election and analysis of past events, not on promoting a specific candidate or party.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>NEWBIZ ONLINE PUBLISHING S.R.L.</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
